newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Douwe Egberts holds Dutch coffee prices for now.
newsitem.headline: Douwe Egberts holds Dutch coffee prices for now.

text.p: Major Dutch coffee roaster Douwe Egberts said on Friday it had no immediate plans to raise retail prices in response to the surge in London-traded coffee futures but added it would watch the situation closely.

Douwe Egberts, which controls 70 percent of the Dutch coffee market and is part of the giant Sara Lee Corpration of the United States, said a prolonged rise in bean prices would eventually feed through into a higher price on supermarket shelves.
"At the moment there is no need to adjust our retail prices but they may be changed in the future," spokesman Joost den Haan told Reuters.
"It is our policy to adjust consumer retail prices as a structurally higher or lower base material price is reflected in the cost price of our products," he added.

Coffee futures, the benchmark for setting world physical prices, are up 30 percent this year on increasing fears of producer nations clubbing together to curb supplies. --David Evans, Amsterdam Newsroom +31 20 504 5000
